posts.post_content: He has some nice flavour and the art is incredible but at ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) I would expect a little more bang for my buck (today they print [Ant Queen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ant Queen) by the way), like being a real insect lord (all insects get+1/+1). And his ability contradicts his presence a bit: In order to be prepared for a big pump I have to abandon a juicy attack.
posts.html:
He has some nice flavour and the art is incredible but at I would expect a little more bang for my buck (today they print Ant Queen by the way), like being a real insect lord (all insects get+1/+1). And his ability contradicts his presence a bit: In order to be prepared for a big pump I have to abandon a juicy attack.

posts.post_content: i remember when i first started, everyone at my school had this guy in thier green decks (around onslaught). you didn't attack with him, you blocked. an untapped thriss is a scary thing to be attacking into, (again removal was very prevalent in our schools meta game as not as many good removal options existed then. [commander eesha](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=commander eesha) was nearly unkillable then)

Posted By: Enemy_Tricolor (6/5/2011 12:57:57 AM)

posts.post_content:
@ Draugnor  
  
You may as well say "Combos with anything that has Trample" as well, since that's not really a combo.   
  
A combo would be a pair or more of cards that may not be great alone, but together, create something impressive. [Ophidian Eyes](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ophidian Eyes) aren't that great alone, but if they're given to [Niv-Mizzet, The Firemind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Niv-Mizzet, The Firemind), you can deal nearly infinite damage. THAT'S a combo.  
  
Here's a decent combo (although slightly hypocritical): [Defiant Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Defiant Elf). It's power and toughness are too weak to use it's Trample to its fullest, but if it's pumped just slightly, your opponent will have a monster of a problem.
posts.html:
@ Draugnor

You may as well say "Combos with anything that has Trample" as well, since that's not really a combo.

A combo would be a pair or more of cards that may not be great alone, but together, create something impressive. Ophidian Eyes aren't that great alone, but if they're given to Niv-Mizzet, The Firemind, you can deal nearly infinite damage. THAT'S a combo.

Here's a decent combo (although slightly hypocritical): Defiant Elf. It's power and toughness are too weak to use it's Trample to its fullest, but if it's pumped just slightly, your opponent will have a monster of a problem.

posts.post_content:
So I was curious to see if any creatures that tap to grant +X/+X until EoT had a decent community rating (Above 4). This guy, Magma Sliver and Timberwatch Elf are it. A little sad to see that it takes this much to make that mechanic useful.  
I do prefer this guy over Gigantomancer thou.
